alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Lunenburg; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 7:50PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Virginia, including the following counties, Brunswick, Lunenburg and Nottoway. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 749 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen during the past two hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area in the next 30 to 60 minutes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blackstone, Victoria, Kenbridge, Alberta, Dundas, Fort Pickett, Barrows Store, Forkland, Danieltown, Irby, Murdocks, Lafoon Corner, Blackstone Airport, Dominy Corner, Ordsburg, Cochran, The Falls, Rawlings, Rubermount and Dolphin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
